meanings.definition: To vote against or veto someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She blackballs any new ideas at the meetings.
meanings.sent2: The committee decided to blackball the proposal.
meanings.sent3: The cat blackballs any changes to its daily routine.
meanings.sent4: His stubbornness blackballs progress in the project.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds blackball any chance of a picnic today.

meanings.sent1: The blackballs outnumbered the approvals in the final count.
meanings.sent2: Receiving a blackball can be disheartening for a candidate.
meanings.sent3: The blackballs in the ballot box seemed to frown at the hopefuls.
meanings.sent4: The blackball cast a shadow over the applicant's chances.
meanings.sent5: The room fell silent after the loud thud of the blackball hitting the box.

meanings.definition: A black ball used in a game or lottery.
meanings.sent1: The player drew a blackball from the bag.
meanings.sent2: The lottery winner celebrated finding the blackball in the draw.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child rolled the blackball across the floor.
meanings.sent4: The blackball spun around before landing on the winning number.
meanings.sent5: The blackball gleamed under the bright lights of the stage.
